bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Antonio Perez Benitoa, April 22, 1948

div1.p: Hench returns Benitoa's photographs. He informs Benitoa of Moran's status as a yellow fever volunteer.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Antonio Perez Benitoa, April 22, 1948
div1.opener:
April 22, 1948
Senor Antonio Perez Benitoa
Quinta Avenue No. 8
Havana, Cuba
My dear Senor Benitoa:
div1.p:
You may remember my visit to your home in Company with Mr. John
Moran about a month ago. On this occasion I was hunting for some air views
of Quemados, especially views near the Finca San Jose. I am sending you here-
with a reprint which will show the reason for my interest in that location.
It was there that Major Walter Reed of the U. S. Army confirmed the theory
of your illustrious scientist, Doctor Carlos Finlay, concerning the propaga-
tion of yellow fever, about which I am writing a book.

You were kind enough to lend me several photographs. I have had
these copied and am surprised to see how well they came out. I appreciate
very greatly your courtesy in having loaned me these photographs. They will
be of the greatest help to me. I think you would be interested to see how
the copies came out and I enclose a set. Some of them are almost as good
as the originals. Should you need any other prints and if you cannot locate
the original negatives taken by Mr. Leo Hamburg (was that the name?) I shall
be glad to have further prints made for you. If you find the name, or par-
ticularly the current address of the aviator who took the pictures, I should
like very much to write him and perhaps borrow the original films. I believe
he may live in Miami but I am not sure of his name and do not know his address.

If you have time to read the enclosed reprint, you will see what
contribution Mr. John Moran made to medical science and humanity. He was one
of Walter Reed's first guinea pigs and at the risk of his life, accepted
experimental yellow fever. He deserves our respect and honor.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
